description:
Arithmetic game for 1, 2 or any number of people

In addition to the basic form - BINGOLETTE - the game contains six other rules. In the basic form, the aim is to achieve a number between 1 and 36 with the three dice rolled using any arithmetic operation (adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, exponentiating or rooting). This is then covered on the game board and the player receives the points according to the number on the edge. When all game board spaces are covered, the player with the highest total points wins. The six other rules of the game are: 1. Raffkes Los, 2. Holzauktion, 3. Stall fürs Pferd, 4. Graben und Brücke, 5. Gewinn-Mühle, 6. Der Rechenmeister.

—user summary

Designed by Harry Wollerton and refined by David Parlett, Black Squares is a pencil-and-paper (and pen-and-eraser) word game in which two players are filling in a crossword grid. However, players don't score points by creating words; they score points by identifying the locations of black squares.

DATTO! is a trick-taking game based on the fable of the Hare & the Tortoise. It is ostensibly a race game, in which the player to advance the farthest will win.

Turn order for each trick is based upon the players' position in the race, with the players who have advanced the least playing cards to each trick first. Players must follow suit if possible, and the winner will advance a number of spaces equal to the lowest value played in the lead suit. If only one card of the lead suit is played, the player advances a number of spaces equal to the number of cards left in their hand.

Each player also receives a "nap" card, which allows them to sit out of one trick.

Each player embodies a personality in DANY's head and one player will secretly be DANY’s true personality and another will be the Dany's Reason. Each turn, the Active Personality will be awarded one of five Ideas he/she will have to make the other personalities guess using Memory cards (illustrated cards). Once the cards composition is made, and after some discussion between the players, the one to the right of the Active Personality gives the answer of his/her choice and success or failure is given to all players. A new tour begins with a new Active Personality. 
The game ends if there is: 

     6 successes: secondary personalities win,
     4 failures or if the Memory draw pile is empty: the Final Twist takes place. Players must eliminate DANY in a vote. If DANY is eliminated, the secondary personalities win, otherwise DANY and the DANY's Reason win and finally gets to live with some peace of mind. 


In this new version of Dany: discover the Dany's Reason, and play with pop culture movie titles. What to expect from DANY: creativity, deduction, bluff and communication in an abstract and cinematographic universe.

These rules use a lot of new mechanisms. Each player has about 6 units, In a fight a unit would typically shieldwall, issue challenges, advance to contact whilst sending in line breakers. The fight might break the shield walls kill the men etc...

This is a historical set, which requires the player to play historically rather than giving the players what they like and then writing rules around that.

—description from the publisher

Western rules that cover the battles of the Old West.

These replace the 1992 Hey you in the Jail set. We usually update rules after about 10 years.
These rules are  designed for games wherein the figures operate in groups. They are not a skirmish set .

WESTERN is an historical game (the word "faction" is not used)
There are ten force options (Mexicans, Plains Indians, townsfolk, posse, Gunmen, army, workers, cattlemen....).

A typical force in 15mm would use 100 figures (about 50 in 25mm) put into 5 groups. 
5 x 3 table. 
All mechanisms uses the table grid (6 inch squares for 15mm, 8" for 25mm etc).

The rules will use the usual wire bound "lay flat" PP style.
The signature PP grid system is also used. Western is full of new ideas and elegant processes.

As usual the play sheets and battle sheet swill be "down loadable" free of charge on the PP website.

PBI (Poor Bloody Infantry) is a Miniatures wargame ruleset for WW2 company level gaming.

For 10 to 25 mm miniatures.

PBI is designed to allow fast playing games that finish in a couple of hours.

PBI uses a terrain map made from grid squares (6") so no measuring is needed.

It is a complete game system, including:

     scenario generator,
     points,
     victory schedule.


—description from the publisher

This game is trick-taking game.
The game consists of a 49 playing card deck. The game features top runners and swimmers between 1908 and 1980. The runners and swimmers are ranked on the cards 1 through 48.
Players bid the number of tricks they feel they can take. They try to take tricks they bid.

—user summary

The principle of the game is to align cubes "to make combinations like poker or yams". The game consists of 26 cubes, each with two visuals of playing cards. It is played face to face: when all the cubes are turned over, each player announces his best combination: royal flush, square, full, three of a kind, etc.

Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Music, Music, Music, Pink- Down the Pub, Yellow- Home Entertainment, Brown- Sports & Fitness, Green- Lazing, and Orange- Pay to Enjoy.

Players customize armies by selecting dice from their personal collections.  Each die costs points equal to the number of sides it has, and both players spend an equal number of points.  In a series of battles, players roll all their surviving dice, line them up from highest to lowest, and eliminate dice facing a higher rolled value.  Dice with no opponent automatically survive the round.  Repeat until one side is eliminated.

Part of the DICE-tractions series of games.

Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers. 
Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle. 
We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size.

So what are you waiting for?

Wear the general commander’s shoulder pads, equip yourself with a capable table, a practical ruler to measure, a pair of dice and get ready to lead hundreds or thousands of armed in epic and exciting battles of history!

—description from the publisher

Zoollywood is a 2 or 4-player abstract strategy game with a theme of penguin actors trying to win a film audition.

On your turn, you must take one of 3 actions: Landing, Hatching and Exploring. Continue taking turns until one player places all their 16 Penguin Eggs on the board.

—description from the publisher

It's the time of the year when big Hollywood studios are thirsty for new screenplays that will surely become the next big summer blockbuster. Screenwriters — often working in teams — try desperately to get a foot in the door, to land a meeting with a powerful film executive. So many screenwriters are knocking on the door, but big breaks are one-in-a-million.

Million Dollar Script takes place in a lavish Hollywood office. Through extensive market research, the studio has identified the perfect hero, as well as an equally perfect villain counterpart in order to make them millions. But beyond that, these bigwigs aren't taking any chances; they're going to be following that tried-and-true structure of nearly every record-breaking blockbuster of the past forty years. This film will be one of the greats like Star Wars, The Lord of the Rings, The Avengers, and Titanic.

Two writing teams have been invited to pitch their finest most preeminent ideas to a studio executive, a.k.a. "the Exec". During the meeting, both teams are working on the same movie, pitching their ideas for each of the five traditional story events. Each round the Exec picks the pitch they prefer, which then becomes part of the shared storyline. The losing pitch gets discarded and treated as if it never existed, much like what should have happened to Battlefield Earth: A Saga of the Year 3000.

Each team of screenwriters is trying to nudge its way into the good graces of the Exec by winning the majority of the five rounds and scoring points in order to secure the profitable writing deal for themselves.

—description from the publisher

Dodge falling boulders and escape the Earth Giant's anger with this Spin Master Frozen II Rumbling Rock board game. The variety of risks and opportunities add some suspense to the game play. This Spin Master Frozen II Rumbling Rock board game comes with a scenic 3-D insert, so you can do a realistic reenactment of scenes from the Frozen II movie.

—description from the publisher

How do you make a game about the great Smoky Mountains?  While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Smokies we could into this box.  It's full of big adventures, family attractions, breathtaking views and of course...a black bear or two - a little something for those who love the mountains!  Looking for a fun way to experience the Land of Blue Mist?

—description from the publisher

Saddle up and ride with horses of every color, breed, and personality! Round-up four beautifully photographed horse cards and read a colorful description of a horse. Then, each player secretly votes which horse best suits that story. Score when your "horse sense" matches other players. You'll be surprised what your horse-loving friends think!

—description from the publisher

Players fight each others characters with spells, treasures, magical items and heavy weapons/armor in this fun and fast (30 min) drafting game for 2-4 players.

Fight Fight is a battle drafting game where players control two characters in front of them. At the end of every round, each of your characters will fight their neighboring opponents character to your left and right.

Each round you will draft one card from the pile passed to you, then all players will simultaneously play one of three total cards in hand and then the cards played will resolve...


     Draft Spells to mess with your opponents or give yourself advantages! 
     Draft Treasure cards to out wit your adversaries and take the ever growing treasure pool in the center of the table! 
     Draft End Game Scoring cards to maximize your strategies during the game!
     Most importantly, draft Magical Items and Heavy Weapons and Armor because at the end of every round, your characters each have to Fight Fight!


—description from the publisher

You and your people emerge from a glistening fog into a sprawling world much like your own, yet...fabricated? At your backs lie the unending silver dunes you came from. To the east and west stand massive walls that could only be the work of an intelligence much greater than your own. And crackling over the horizon is a massive storm that pulses with an otherworldly glow. Your resources are low, time is short...and you are not alone.

In Suns of Chronos, control one of four races and explore a world full of strange lifeforms and mysterious artifacts. Manage your people and your time wisely, between exploiting the wonders of Chronos - such as the time-defying "sunstones" - and thwarting those who get in your way. Be wary, however. Besides your rivals, Chronos contains entities of its own that will challenge not only your people, but the very fabric of time upon which you depend.

On the machine world of Chronos, those who carry out the will of their people best will go on to see a new universe. The rest will be lost to the sands of time.

—description from the publisher

Burglar is a whole new twist on family board games.

It's a game involving skill, chance, memory and tactics as you hunt for loot and get the chance to block opponents from reaching their own target items or escaping undetected.

The game board and tiles have the simple elegance of 1920s sophistication and it's one of those games that's simple to learn but different every time you play.

It's a family friendly game that lasts around 30 minutes which gets more devious every time  as you learn tactics to frustrate opponents and use your best negotiating skills to gang up on players.

—description from the designer

Carrot Bunny Den is a competitive little card game to share among friends (ages 18+). It is played by 3 to 10 players and games last about 15 minutes. It is very quick to learn and triggers good bursts of laughter. The graphical direction may surprise you but it's just like the gameplay, it looks cute but it's hard!

In Carrot Bunny Den, nature goes crazy and it's up to us to fix it. Each player starts with 3 cards representing combinations of the words "carrot", "rabbit" and " den" and a decadent vision of our poor nature. During the game, the players exchange words by pointing at each other and saying one of these three words. But beware, each word has an associated rule! One must not make mistakes when speaking and remain attentive to the words spoken. Indeed, when a spoken combination corresponds to one of your cards, you can put it down!

It's a game of memory and quick decision making. Players must choose the words they say skillfully and quickly, according to their hand. They choose who they give the floor to based on what they understand of other people's play. They have to adapt constantly to hope to put down every card. The first player to put down all his hand wins the round and the game is played in three winning rounds. Nature needs you! Ready for the challenge?

—description from the designer
Sea Wars: Light wargame intended for the age ranges of 10 and older.

INDIA - 300 BCE

The Royal Mauryan empire taught its children to raise and care for horses as their own, rear them as allies in the battlefield and beyond.

Citizens from far and wide would come to watch competent charioteers race through the forests and the ravines, the rivers and the marshes at the most celebrated chariot races.

The charioteers marked territory and showed immense skill - no obstacle too hard, no weather too dangerous.

And thus was born a legacy - the races of the ‘Chariots of Chandragupta’.

Chariots of Chandragupta is another exciting game from the makers of Yudhbhoomi.

Get ready to race like the royals!

Build a track, choose your charioteer, load your Chariot with resources and spin the arrow. You have 2 actions in your turn: use your resource tokens and spin the arrow (in any order).

You can move fast, earn resources, buy resources and earn some special benefits too. The battle to be first can be influenced/hindered further when you get the 'Karma' cards. Also, watch out for obstacles! Get a lead, lay additional obstacles and be the first charioteer to make it back to the palace to win the race!

—description from the publisher

Knights of NorthRnd is a 2-6 player, last man standing, medieval themed card game where each player chooses a card from 5 to play at the same time, then the loser losses gems depending on how much damage is dealt, it takes the concept of rock, paper, scissors, but I have changed it to swords, shields and arrows.

—description from the designer

Phantom Division is a fully co-operative tactical combat game set in a sci-fi world of impending danger. Players choose a member of the elite Phantom Division defence force and are dispatched on a mission to protect a remote colony planet against an unknown and implacable enemy. The game features an innovative, challenging AI system that efficiently controls the enemies, different primary and secondary objectives for each mission, and "plot twists" that can introduce unexpected events into the game.

Combat is resolved either by rolling dice or by flicking the Phantom's bullets. The flicking based combat is completely optional. It also includes several mini-games where players will pilot shuttles, hack computer terminals, and defuse bombs. At the end of a mission, the players will have the opportunity to upgrade their Phantom for the next mission using XP they collected.

The game has full solo player support.

—description from the publisher

Surface Fire - Naval Combat in World War 2 is a table-top game designed to simulate the naval engagements that took place all around the globe during World War 2 (from 1939-1945).

The rules have been structured to enable new gamers to readily understand and enjoy playing the game.

Designed for 1/2400th scale ships and planes
1 mini = 1 ship
1 planes base = 1 squadron
1 turn = 10 min

These rules include: 

     Naval Data sheets, 
     Templates, 
     100+ markers


—description from the publisher

CONTEXT
Moonlight Brewers is a game where you'll be playing Trappist monks competing in order to brew the best beer. And as you may guess, they can only do it when the moon is full and the Werewolves roam. Hunters and preys at the same time, the Werewolves are both a danger and the ingredient for the beer.
In order to make it through the night and to brew THE beer, you'll have to build amazing strategies, backed up by a good amount of luck.

HOW TO PLAY
- Pick up the ingredient you need to collect in this phase of brewing. 
- Better ingredient means harder to get and will make more noise.
- Hunt Werewolves as a special ingredient for you beer
- Too much noise and you will be hunted by the Weres
- The Monk with the best beer win the game.

CONTENT
Print & Play game
1 MONASTERY (board)
1 RULES BOOKLET
63 CARDS (19 MONKS, 18 WERE, 13 EQUIPMENTS, 13 BENEDICTIONS)
8 MODS
1 SCARY SHEET
26 SMALL CARDS
THE CAMPAIGN OF THE WHITE WOLF

MORE CONTENT
Hermit Brewer - A solo mode extension : included in basic version
The Night of the Beast : included in basic version

—description from the publisher

Dogfight Over the Trenches is a fast-paced and exciting game designed to replicate the air battles and combat missions that took place in the skies over the battlefields of the Great War from 1915 to 1918.

This book contains not only the core rules for playing out missions, but a set of advanced rules for more complex and in-depth gameplay.

There are tons of planes to choose from, and aircraft availability tables to match the year YOU want to fly in!

—description from the publisher

Pirates is the exciting game of beer drinking and treasure hunting you can play with your whole family.

Dodge aliens, British, tigers, and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because Black Beard the pirate will be out for blood!

—description from the publisher

JOWLS is the exciting table top game of scuba diving and beer that you can play  with your whole family.

Swim through red algae, seaweed, and dodge moray eels and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because JOWLS is always hungry!

—description from the publisher

38 page rulebook includes 52 random Event Cards

In Mushrooms by Mail, two players attempt to coordinate their pixie workers to deliver various fungal treats to a band of incredulously fussy trolls.

Players draft dice determining which spaces they can send their pixies to, and attempt to control both the crops of 'shrooms and the access to trolls — as well as the greedy troll that will eat anything!

Collect helper tokens along the way to help augment your dice rolls. Feed the trolls!

—description from the publisher

In Braves, Retry!, you will be fighting against the dark overlords with the help of different goddesses. Send out your braves toward the different missions, beware of the power of the different goddesses. With the right power, you may defeat the army of dark overlords easily. A meta-story based on the overabundance of Isekai & Reincarnation genre anime.

”I used to be an adventuring Brave, then I took an arrow in the knee.”

Evil Bosses from other planes have conquered the Kingdom of Man…
Courageous warriors and soldiers around the world have all perished in the war…

”My dear Brave, was your knee hit by this Golden Excalibur, or this Silver Kusanagi?”

The 3 Goddesses who watch over the world awakens, and the souls of the Braves are summoned back one by one…

”Um, no… It was just a plain, ordinary arrow…”

The bugle of resistance echoes over the horizon, now it’s your time to save the world again!

”My honest Brave, in the name of the 3 Goddesses, please offer your knees again!”

Players will take turns dispatching their Braves to fight various Bosses by drafting location cards. You may also pray to the 3 Goddesses for special powers to assist you with the battle or hinder other player’s progress. At the end of each round, the player with more Braves in each Battleground gets to pick rewards first from each Boss fight.

The game ends after 5 rounds, then the player with the highest score wins the game.

In The Cloud Dungeon 2: Sunken Dungeon, 1-6 players color and construct their characters, buying and attaching armor and weapons, and making their own, utterly unique creations. Your party is 'borrowing' a submarine and setting out for the Sunken Dungeon: a defunct, dangerous place full of sea creatures, monsters, and green olives. You're hoping there's treasure in there, someplace. Throughout the process, you'll be engaging in hand-to-claw combat with crabs, electrifying whales, and working together to pilot your submarine in intense submarine battles.

Along the way, you'll be making choose-your-own adventure-style decisions as a team, with huge (and ridiculous) consequences. You'll lose your leg, have starfish plastered all over you, and tangle with a Very Cheerful Squid who wants to kill you. It's ridiculous fun for any player who is creative, loves coloring, or wants to have a fun coloring adventure with their friends, family, or game group.

—description from the publisher

The Liphook Historical Wargames Group was formed in 2000 to refight Napoleon’s major battles during their 200th anniversary year. During the last 16 years the group has successfully fought over 38 battles, which have included Wagram, Salamanca, Borodino, Leipzig and Waterloo, using its own, home-grown set of specially designed rules.

Art of Command evolved from the group’s desire to refight big, multiplayer battles. The set aim was to simulate the confusion and impact the chain of command has on such major engagements through the interaction of players representing the various commanders from brigade through divisions and corps to army level. The objective is to replicate the historical ebb and flow of battle at battalion, squadron and battery level, refight them over an accurately contoured, scaled model and complete them in a day.

The group initially tested existing, commercial rule sets but felt that these were designed for small table engagements lasting a couple of hours or larger games with brigades being the smallest units represented. It was concluded that we needed rules that would encompass command, communications and control functions.  Rules that would enable us to coordinate and accommodate a large group of commanders refighting battles the size of Waterloo, but still represent battalions and squadrons on the wargame table.  We believe Art of Command fulfills this need and the fact that the group successfully completed almost all the battles in a day is a testament to the robust nature of the rules and the thorough testing which has taken place.

We recommend Art of Command to those wargamers who wish to simulate a major Napoleonic, multiplayer battle in a day.   We hope that you find their simplicity and resultant speed of play beneficial in recreating your own big battles and, above all, recreate the fun and excitement of a hobby that we all enjoy.

Scale:
1 fig (inf.-cav.) = 50/60 men
1 gun = 1 gun
Ground Scale: 1/1000 for 25/28 mm  (half for 15mm)
each Game Period: 10-15 min real time

—description from the publisher

In Friday the 13th: Horror at Camp Crystal Lake, an anxiety-driven, press-your-luck horror game, players take on the roles of cliché camp counselors like the stereotypical Nerd, the Partier, the Nice Guy, the Final Girl, the Diva, and the Jock as they rely on chance and strategy to survive five nights being terrorized by blood-thirsty Jason. Coveted tools of survival are just within your reach to randomly draw from a camp bag: cast iron pans, gasoline, cleavers, flashlights and more. Collect them to make various combinations for points and use additional fear cards for ways to escape his attacks.

You have only strategy and supplies to keep you alive, but the odds of returning safely to the camp get slimmer with every turn! Steal supplies from your friends, take them with you to the cabin, or keep what you find and wait out the nights to be the last one standing!

—description from the publisher

Designed to recreate actual battles, In Deo Veritas focuses on the command decisions needed to maintain the motivation of the army. The six actual battle scenarios provide a range of different challenges from the warfare of the seventeenth century.

Battles are played at the brigade level with all major elements are on 75mm/3" wide bases. 
Using smaller scale figures (6-15mm) lets players give their units a realistic feel. 
The ground scale of 1" = 40yds means the typical 6ft x 4 ft table is large enough to accommodate most battles of the period.

Most players will already have everything needed to play (d6, tape measure and a deck of cards).

To learn the rules will take 2 hours or so using some of the smaller battles. Once you have become familiar with the core elements then your games will flow more quickly and a larger battle such as Wittstock should last for 3-4 hours depending on the arrival of the reinforcements!

Nothing is certain; but generals that hone their skills are more likely to be victorious.

—description from the publisher

After slumbering for 1000 years, the great wizard Magnus awoke to a shattered world. What was once a single, connected world had become four distinct continents. With the aim of finding heroes with the ability to connect the world once again, Magnus departed towards the ice continent Frirna by airship. It was only then that he learned of an invisible force referred to as the Corruption that had turned some of the world’s greatest heroes against one another…

Champions Coliseum is a 2-4 player competitive card game where you select a party of characters and fight until only one party remains. With 24 characters, 20 unique items, and 15 events, every match is a completely new experience!

Players begin by selecting characters for their party in a draft pick setting. Once the game begins, players take turns by using actions with a character. The game progresses until only one player has characters remaining alive.

Champions Coliseum’s strategy comes through masterful use of elemental abilities, positioning, items, and events. Elemental abilities deal double damage to opposing elements—however, this means that each element’s weakest target is also its biggest threat. Characters placed in the back row cannot be attacked until the character in front of them is defeated, meaning that weaker characters are often placed in the back. Items and events are dealt randomly each round, adding a hint of chance to the strategic gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Victory at Sea is the game of naval combat during the Second World War. 
Throughout 1939–45, the nations of the world duelled across the oceans across the globe, only to discover the fundamental nature of naval warfare changing in the face of rapidly developing technologies. 
Now you can play out these confrontations on the tabletop with entire fleets drawn from the Royal Navy, US Navy, Imperial Japanese Navy, German Kriegsmarine or any of the other nations featured in Victory at Sea.

From skirmishes involving single destroyers hunting down merchantmen to the clashing of massive battleships, from invasions of islands across the Pacific to mastering waves of dive bombers, Victory at Sea enables you to fight exciting battles that take place on the oceans of World War II.

The Battle for the Pacific starter set focuses primarily on actions in the seas of the Far East – the Imperial Japanese Navy and the mighty US Navy clashing for control of the islands, resources and seas of the Pacific Theatre.

The Victory at Sea rules manual presented in this starter game contain all you need to know to begin playing with the fleets included.

Some of the ships contained in this set have been released individually:
Victory at Sea: USS Indianapolis 1944
Victory at Sea: Kumano 1944
Victory at Sea: USS Northampton 1942
Victory at Sea: Furutaka 1939
Victory at Sea: USS Chicago 1942
Victory at Sea: Mogami 1939

Contents:
A4 Battle of the Pacific Rules manual
1 Die-cut game tokens sheet
15 Model Ships
  â€£ 1 USS Indianapolis 1944
  â€£ 1 USS Northampton 1942
  â€£ 1 USS Chicago 1942
  â€£ 1 Mogami 1939
  â€£ 1 Kumano 1944
  â€£ 1 Furutaka 1939
  â€£ 3 Fubuki-class Destroyer
  â€£ 6 Fletcher-class Destroyer
15 Ship Cards & Damage Sliders
4 Ten-sided dice
12 Six-sided dice
2 A0 Sea Mat

—description from the publisher

Chef de Char is a beer and pretzel ruleset to simulate tank combats.
Each player represents a tank leader and gives orders to his crew, those are then executed.
For 10 to 28 mm minis
5-12 vehicles per side.
This version add corrections to v1 as well as additions for the War in North Africa
—description from the publisher (translated

Chef de Char est une règle rapide de combats entres blindés, simple à appréhender. La règle s'adresse autant aux joueurs confirmés qu'aux novices. Chaque joueur incarne, au moment où il active un de ses blindés, le chef du char actif. Il donne à son équipage des ordres qui sont ensuite exécutés. Une partie est jouable en 45 minutes par deux à quatre joueurs. 
La règle couvre les théâtres d'opérations d'Afrique du nord (1940/1943) et d'Europe (à partir de 43).
La règle décrit le profil des principaux chars utilisés sur ces théâtres d’opérations par les nations suivantes, France, Italie, Allemagne, Angleterre, USA, Russie.
—description from the publisher

A very rare and unusual game within the Balyna series of 1950s sports games. The main games were football and cricket however Balyna also produced baseball, tennis and golf games too.
Played on a roll out pitch with small plastic figures, a metal ball rolling chute and a metal batting gantry.
The highlight of the game is the superb marked out baseball diamond pitch.

—user summary

This four day battle is one of the more gruesome fights in the Pacific Theater.  This game showcases a unique landing system.  While the fight to capture the island is not really 'in doubt', the Marines have a difficult time of wresting control of the place from the tough Japanese defenders.  The main battle campaign starts with the Marines aboard their transports.  From there they must move onto the landing craft and make their approaches to the beach.  The fire from the Japanese ashore is heavy and, as the Marines dicovered to their dismay, the reef causes a major disruption in the landing plan.  It also creates plenty of easy targets for the Japanese player to hammer.  Once ashore the Marines are going to be hammering away with everything they have and the dugin enemy positions are hard to eliminate.  Securing the island within 4 days is no picnic and playing it safe will not cut it.  The Marines need to be aggressive and willing to take casualties in order to move forward.

In the Landing system all Marines start on their transports.  When they become available on the Wave Chart they are loaded onto their landing craft.  From there they move to the Landing Craft Beach Chart.  From here the Landing Craft determine which hexrow of the beach lane they will enter the map.  This can cause some serious traffic jams.  Then the landing craft make their run ins' to the beach.  This is pretty exciting in itself, but then the Marines find wire and mine obstacles waiting for them in front of the sandy beach.  These cause major problems in landing.  The net result of all this is some very high nervousness about whether the Marines will get a solid bridgehead ashore.  The most problematic beach is RED 1.  The Marines here almost didn't make it and it is where the 'the Issue is in Doubt' quote comes from.  You will do better I'm sure.

There are some small scenarios, focusing on 1 beach, an intro scenario of the 2/8 Marines attacking on 22 Nov, and a 'what if' scenario should the Marine player decide to try his hand landing on the 'Black' beaches.  These beaches were located on the seaward side of the island and were covered by extensive minefields.  Good luck with that.

This game includes:
-(8) 11x17 map sections of Tarawa, (2) 22x34 map equivalents 34" across by 41" top to bottom
-5x Unit counter and marker sheets
-Death Ride - Tarawa Master and Supplemental Rules
-Charts and tables similar to other Death Ride games to support the system; and
-Charts that are specific to support the Amphibious Landing such as the Wave Chart and Transport Chart

-description from the publisher

The player(s) travel around a modular board, unveiling different Landscape Tiles as they go. Different terrains allow you to build different buildings, such as a Forest being a good place to build a Sawmill. The player(s) gather various resources in order to expand their Kingdom and construct more advanced buildings.

As the player(s) progress, they will be able to recruit and equip an army to defend their newly forged Kingdom. This is necessary, as during the game they will also be drawing from a deck of cards. These cards will be of two different types; Enemy Cards and Event Cards. The former will detail the forces gathering at your borders, ready to invade, while the latter will add a little spice to your game in the form of random events. These range from mine collapses, fires, floods, plague or occasionally something not so bad.

Once the deck of cards has run out, the time for building is over. From that point on it is a do or die final battle against your enemies. Have you prepared enough to survive? Or will your Kingdom crumble to dust?

—description from the designer

Ascension Tactics is a revolutionary new game, pioneering a brand-new genre by combining the best of tactical miniatures games with the fast-paced strategy of deck-building games.  Ascension Tactics brings the most iconic characters from the award-winning deck-building game to life as highly-detailed paintable 3D miniatures.
 
     Many ways to play! Battle through the campaign mode or try the various PvP, Cooperative, and Solo Scenarios.
     PvP drafting mode allows players to build their armies before a battle. 
     Players acquire cards from the ever-changing center row to power up their forces. 
     Even the smallest miniature can take down mighty beasts by gaining command points and equipping magical constructs. 
     No dice rolling required!


—description from the publisher

An evening like any other, in a quiet town, strange creatures suddenly began to appear. Nothing to worry about at the beginning but after a few hours the town was literally surrounded by these stinking and putrescing humanoid beings. And who has to save all the inhabitants? Obviously to one of the heroes like you! It doesn't matter if you are a neighborhood hooligan, a world-famous sports personage or an elderly lady skilled in gardening, THE TOWN NEEDS YOU!

In UAZG, each player plays an inhabitant of a small town hit by a zombie outbreak. The aim of the game is to reach the rescue teams, which appear after a certain number of game turns, depending on the number of players; very difficult mission without the character upgrade, an upgrade that can be obtained by completing the missions that will be available during the game.

UAZG is a Semi-Cooperative Zombie Game, this is because during the game you will have to cooperate to survive, but at the moment of the arrival of the rescuers maybe someone could have the brilliant idea of caring about the companions and saving the skin, since the rescuers will not have time to wait too long among thousands of zombies.
The game is based on the Pick-Up & Delivery mechanics and it will be essential to cooperate to complete the missions that will advance the 'Game Time'. Not doing any mission during a turn means advancing the 'Danger Marker' by a space that will lead after a few turns to fail and lose the game.
During the game there will be the level increases that will enhance the character of your choice and there will be the possibility of crafting useful objects or weapons, managing inventory better. In addition, there will be an opportunity to trade weapons with the heads of killed zombies.

—description from the publisher

Solve addition, subtraction and multiplication sums to fill your wizard board with yucky ingredients. Pick a card, solve the sum and rub the black star on the back of the card to magically reveal (and check) the answer. If it matches the number on one of your spell ingredients cards, add it to your board.

The Danger Word game is a wildly funny and unpredictable guessing game based on the Danger Word challenges seen on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games. Players choose a card and give teammates one-word clues hoping that they'll guess the Winning Word on the card…not the Danger Word. Who can get teammates to say "pool" but not "swim", or "infant" but not "baby"? Saying the Danger Word gets that player stamped with an X. Teams win by collecting 5 cards or if the other team gets 3 stamps.

—description from the publisher

No Freakin Way! is a hilarious game where you discover just how well you know your friends and relatives. You'll be surprised at what they'll do for a buck! A player is presented with a crazy scenario, then the other players at the table can add to the scenario, making it even crazier. Then the original player must decide just how much-or how little-it would take to perform the challenge. All other players try to guess the amount the original player has chosen-using poker-like chips valued from one dollar all the way to "No Freakin Way!" Everyone reveals their best guess the same time. Those who guess correctly, get "gems". The player with the most "gems" at the end is the winner.

Fast and easy game for kids and parents.
In the game you have to create your own flower garden taking tiles and adding them to your existing flower beds in domino-like manner.

Game consist of 48 square tiles with four flower-beds each (this number includes three special tiles – a pond, a gnome and a rock – which can be placed anywhere). At the reverse site each tile has a number from 1 to 4, that indicates how many different flower types this tile is composed of (number 1 means that the tile has all four flower beds of one type, while number 4 shows, that each of triangle-shaped flower bed is of different type).
Players will draw covered tiles in turn trying to arrange most beautiful garden, however look out! As new tile can be placed next to already owned tile only if it shares the same flower type along the same edge (special tiles are treated as “blanks” and can be placed at any place). Players will continue the game, until all tiles are drawn.
At the end of the game, players count their score:
total player’s score = number of triangular areas in their single biggest closed flower bed + number of tiles in their biggest filled rectangular shaped area within their garden.
Player with the most points wins.

Presentation on Essen Spiel 2021

Shadow Gates is an asymmetrical card-based boardgame for 2 to 4 players.

The action takes place in an age of constant clan wars in an alternative-history 16th century Japan.
Aiming to make their warriors invincible, ambitious warlords turn to forbidden magic: shadow gates. The gates lend unhuman strength to the warlords and their armies, while distorting their bodies and their minds. The corruption streams forth from the gates, consuming more and more provinces.
The few remaining clans have to unite to make a stand against the forces of darkness.

The players will side with one of the warring factions: the Keepers of the Gates or the Free Clans.
The game is utilizing the following features: hidden agenda, territory control and hand management. Each side has its own unique asymmetrical card-based mechanics for performing actions: moving forces, conducting rituals, initiating battles, building defences etc. The objective of the game is carrying out personal hidden agendas. The game uses highly detailed miniatures and a large playing board.

The game is set in a haunted house. Cards are used to represent different rooms of the house, and players explore and react to events that take place in the rooms.

House of Cards requires a token for each player, 2 decks of standard playing cards (jokers optional), and 3 sets of tokens (50 "ghost" tokens, 26 "relic" tokens, and 75 "luck" counters).

One deck is shuffled, with about half the cards (chosen randomly) facing up, then dealt in a grid (the larger the grid, the longer the game). Cards are given relic and ghost tokens based on their suit. The second deck is shuffled normally and hands are dealt to the players.

The player can play cards to collect "luck" counters, move through the house, discovering rooms, collecting relics, and fighting ghosts and other players. Once the target number of relics are collected, the winner is decided.
